intro: Micromeria barbata, commonly known as the hairy micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine, stiff hairs, which help reduce water loss. Micromeria barbata is also known for its fragrant, pinkish to white flowers that bloom in early spring.
